page.title: 02CHEBSEY, A FARMING COMMUNITY
page.content: Our area is predominantly a farming community. It is tight knit and several of the farmers are related to one another. They socialise amongst themselves and perhaps have met their marital partners at a Young Farmers Club. Some farmers are self-sufficient in milk. There are no local shops so shopping is done mainly in Eccleshall. The farmer's wife helps at busy times, for example feeding new-born calves. They may also deal with travelling salesmen, sometimes 2 or 3 a week. The current price of land is about Â£2000 an acre, a 90 horse power tractor is about Â£16,000. One of our farmers owns 4 tractors, a combine, a forage harvester, mower, 3 grain/silage tractors, 3 lorries (for straw), ploughs, cultivators and finds his fork-lift truck invaluable.
